🔊 Recorded at PyCon DE & PyData Berlin 2024, 24.04.2024
https://2024.pycon.de/program/BA7FZL/

🎓 Watch Jens Nie as he simplifies building asyncio based applications with powerful yet easy-to-follow patterns, making asyncio a go-to solution for beginners and experts alike. #asyncio #raspberrypi

Speakers:
Jens Nie

Description:
Jens Nie, a physicist turned developer at Rosenxt, presented at AsyncApp. He discussed the increasing use of asyncio in Python but noted it's not the default choice for all projects, especially by beginners. Jens shared his journey creating simple yet powerful asyncio-based applications using lightweight and attractive patterns. 

Asyncio addresses I/O performance problems by preventing code from blocking concurrent elements in an application. While traditional methods like threading and multiprocessing can be complex, asyncio offers a simpler abstraction layer. Jens emphasized that proper threading and multiprocessing require a deep understanding and are often topics for experts. 

To showcase asyncio's efficiency, Jens demonstrated building blocks for creating a Raspberry Pi monitoring app. This app gathers sensor readings, logs them, stores data, and tracks CPU and memory usage. It can be configured through various methods and follows the UNIX philosophy of focusing on specific tasks. With asyncio, Jens highlighted the ease of developing effective applications without intricate knowledge of underlying processes.
